examples.code:
# Matrix Build Strategy
# .github/workflows/matrix-builds.yml

name: üß™ Matrix Testing Strategy

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      test_target:
        description: 'Test target selection'
        required: false
        type: choice
        options:
          - all
          - core
          - integration
        default: 'all'

env:
  FORCE_COLOR: 1
  NODE_OPTIONS: '--max_old_space_size=4096'

jobs:
  # Job 1: Build Matrix
  build-matrix:
    name: üèóÔ∏è Build (${{ matrix.os }}, Node ${{ matrix.node }}, ${{ matrix.package-manager }})
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macos-latest]
        node: ['16', '18', '20']
        package-manager: [npm, yarn, pnpm]
        include:
          # Add experimental combinations
          - os: ubuntu-latest
            node: '21'
            package-manager: npm
            experimental: true
          - os: ubuntu-latest
            node: '18'
            package-manager: bun
            experimental: true
          # Add specific configurations
          - os: ubuntu-latest
            node: '18'
            package-manager: npm
            coverage: true
            sonar: true
        exclude:
          # Exclude Windows + pnpm (compatibility issues)
          - os: windows-latest
            package-manager: pnpm
          # Exclude old Node on macOS (performance)
          - os: macos-latest
            node: '16'
    
    continue-on-error: ${{ matrix.experimental || false }}
    
    outputs:
      build-success: ${{ steps.build.outcome == 'success' }}
      test-results: ${{ steps.test.outputs.results }}
      coverage-report: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.report-url }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js ${{ matrix.node }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node }}
          cache: ${{ matrix.package-manager }}
      
      - name: Setup package manager
        run: |
          case "${{ matrix.package-manager }}" in
            npm)
              echo "Using npm (built-in)"
              ;;
            yarn)
              npm install -g yarn
              echo "PACKAGE_MANAGER=yarn" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
            pnpm)
              npm install -g pnpm
              echo "PACKAGE_MANAGER=pnpm" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
            bun)
              curl -fsSL https://bun.sh/install | bash
              echo "$HOME/.bun/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
              echo "PACKAGE_MANAGER=bun" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
          esac
        shell: bash
      
      - name: Get package manager version
        id: pm-version
        run: |
          case "${{ matrix.package-manager }}" in
            npm) VERSION=$(npm --version) ;;
            yarn) VERSION=$(yarn --version) ;;
            pnpm) VERSION=$(pnpm --version) ;;
            bun) VERSION=$(bun --version) ;;
          esac
          echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Package manager version: $VERSION"
        shell: bash
      
      - name: Cache dependencies
        uses: actions/cache@v3
        with:
          path: |
            ~/.npm
            ~/.yarn
            ~/.cache/pnpm
            ~/.bun
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}-${{ matrix.node }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package*.json') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}-${{ matrix.node }}-
            ${{ runner.os }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}-
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          case "${{ matrix.package-manager }}" in
            npm) npm ci --prefer-offline ;;
            yarn) yarn install --frozen-lockfile ;;
            pnpm) pnpm install --frozen-lockfile ;;
            bun) bun install --frozen-lockfile ;;
          esac
        shell: bash
      
      - name: Build application
        id: build
        run: |
          case "${{ matrix.package-manager }}" in
            npm) npm run build ;;
            yarn) yarn build ;;
            pnpm) pnpm build ;;
            bun) bun run build ;;
          esac
        shell: bash
      
      - name: Run tests
        id: test
        run: |
          TEST_COMMAND="test"
          if [ "${{ inputs.test_target }}" != "all" ]; then
            TEST_COMMAND="test:${{ inputs.test_target }}"
          fi
          
          case "${{ matrix.package-manager }}" in
            npm) npm run $TEST_COMMAND ;;
            yarn) yarn $TEST_COMMAND ;;
            pnpm) pnpm $TEST_COMMAND ;;
            bun) bun run $TEST_COMMAND ;;
          esac
          
          echo "results=passed" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        env:
          NODE_ENV: test
          CI: true
        shell: bash
      
      - name: Generate coverage report
        id: coverage
        if: matrix.coverage
        run: |
          npm run test:coverage
          REPORT_URL="https://codecov.io/gh/${{ github.repository }}/commit/${{ github.sha }}"
          echo "report-url=$REPORT_URL" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
      
      - name: Upload coverage
        if: matrix.coverage
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./coverage/lcov.info
          flags: ${{ matrix.os }}-node${{ matrix.node }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}
          name: coverage-${{ matrix.os }}-node${{ matrix.node }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}
      
      - name: SonarCloud analysis
        if: matrix.sonar
        uses: SonarSource/sonarcloud-github-action@master
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          SONAR_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SONAR_TOKEN }}
      
      - name: Upload build artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: build-${{ matrix.os }}-node${{ matrix.node }}-${{ matrix.package-manager }}
          path: |
            dist/
            build/
            .next/
          retention-days: 3
      
      - name: Performance benchmark
        if: matrix.node == '18' && matrix.package-manager == 'npm'
        run: |
          npm run benchmark
          npm run lighthouse:ci
      
      - name: Create deployment artifact
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' && matrix.node == '18'
        run: |
          tar -czf deployment-${{ github.sha }}.tar.gz \
            dist/ package.json package-lock.json
      
      - name: Upload deployment artifact
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' && matrix.node == '18'
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: deployment-artifact
          path: deployment-${{ github.sha }}.tar.gz
          retention-days: 30

  # Job 2: Cross-Platform Integration Tests
  integration-matrix:
    name: üîó Integration (${{ matrix.platform.os }}, ${{ matrix.database }}, ${{ matrix.cache }})
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.platform.os }}
    needs: build-matrix
    
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        platform:
          - { os: ubuntu-latest, shell: bash }
          - { os: windows-latest, shell: powershell }
          - { os: macos-latest, shell: bash }
        database: [postgres, mysql, mongodb]
        cache: [redis, memcached]
        test-suite: [api, graphql, websocket]
        include:
          # Add specific configurations for heavy testing
          - platform: { os: ubuntu-latest, shell: bash }
            database: postgres
            cache: redis
            test-suite: full
            heavy: true
        exclude:
          # Exclude MongoDB on Windows (Docker issues)
          - platform: { os: windows-latest, shell: powershell }
            database: mongodb
          # Exclude memcached on macOS (compatibility)
          - platform: { os: macos-latest, shell: bash }
            cache: memcached
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: ${{ matrix.database == 'postgres' && 'postgres:15' || '' }}
        env:
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
      
      mysql:
        image: ${{ matrix.database == 'mysql' && 'mysql:8.0' || '' }}
        env:
          MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: root
          MYSQL_DATABASE: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "mysqladmin ping"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 3306:3306
      
      mongodb:
        image: ${{ matrix.database == 'mongodb' && 'mongo:6.0' || '' }}
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "mongo --eval 'db.adminCommand(\"ismaster\")'"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 27017:27017
      
      redis:
        image: ${{ matrix.cache == 'redis' && 'redis:7-alpine' || '' }}
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "redis-cli ping"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 6379:6379
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup platform-specific tools
        shell: ${{ matrix.platform.shell }}
        run: |
          if [ "${{ matrix.platform.os }}" = "ubuntu-latest" ]; then
            sudo apt-get update
            sudo apt-get install -y postgresql-client mysql-client
          elif [ "${{ matrix.platform.os }}" = "macos-latest" ]; then
            brew install postgresql mysql
          elif [ "${{ matrix.platform.os }}" = "windows-latest" ]; then
            choco install postgresql mysql mongodb
          fi
      
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: build-${{ matrix.platform.os }}-node18-npm
          path: ./build-artifacts
      
      - name: Setup services configuration
        shell: ${{ matrix.platform.shell }}
        run: |
          case "${{ matrix.database }}" in
            postgres)
              echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
            mysql)
              echo "DATABASE_URL=mysql://root:root@localhost:3306/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
            mongodb)
              echo "DATABASE_URL=mongodb://localhost:27017/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
          esac
          
          case "${{ matrix.cache }}" in
            redis)
              echo "CACHE_URL=redis://localhost:6379" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
            memcached)
              echo "CACHE_URL=memcached://localhost:11211" >> $GITHUB_ENV
              ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Wait for services
        shell: ${{ matrix.platform.shell }}
        run: |
          echo "Waiting for services to be ready..."
          sleep 10
          
          # Test database connection
          case "${{ matrix.database }}" in
            postgres)
              timeout 30 bash -c 'until pg_isready -h localhost -p 5432; do sleep 1; done' || true
              ;;
            mysql)
              timeout 30 bash -c 'until mysqladmin ping -h localhost -P 3306 -u root -proot; do sleep 1; done' || true
              ;;
            mongodb)
              timeout 30 bash -c 'until mongo --host localhost:27017 --eval "db.adminCommand(\"ismaster\")"; do sleep 1; done' || true
              ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Run integration tests
        shell: ${{ matrix.platform.shell }}
        run: |
          npm run test:integration:${{ matrix.test-suite }}
        env:
          NODE_ENV: test
          CI: true
          TEST_TIMEOUT: 30000
      
      - name: Run heavy test suite
        if: matrix.heavy
        shell: ${{ matrix.platform.shell }}
        run: |
          npm run test:integration:heavy
          npm run test:load:basic
        env:
          NODE_ENV: test
          HEAVY_TESTS: true
      
      - name: Upload integration test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: integration-results-${{ matrix.platform.os }}-${{ matrix.database }}-${{ matrix.cache }}-${{ matrix.test-suite }}
          path: |
            test-results/integration/
            logs/
          retention-days: 7

  # Job 3: Browser Compatibility Matrix
  browser-matrix:
    name: üåê Browser Tests (${{ matrix.browser.name }} ${{ matrix.browser.version }})
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-matrix
    
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        browser:
          - { name: chrome, version: 'latest' }
          - { name: chrome, version: '109' }  # Older version
          - { name: firefox, version: 'latest' }
          - { name: firefox, version: '108' }  # Older version
          - { name: safari, version: 'latest' }
          - { name: edge, version: 'latest' }
        viewport:
          - { width: 1920, height: 1080, name: 'desktop' }
          - { width: 1024, height: 768, name: 'tablet' }
          - { width: 375, height: 667, name: 'mobile' }
        include:
          # Add specific browser + viewport combinations
          - browser: { name: chrome, version: 'latest' }
            viewport: { width: 1920, height: 1080, name: 'desktop' }
            performance: true
            accessibility: true
        exclude:
          # Skip older browsers on mobile (performance)
          - browser: { name: chrome, version: '109' }
            viewport: { width: 375, height: 667, name: 'mobile' }
          - browser: { name: firefox, version: '108' }
            viewport: { width: 375, height: 667, name: 'mobile' }
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '18'
          cache: 'npm'
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: build-ubuntu-latest-node18-npm
          path: ./dist
      
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        run: |
          npx playwright install ${{ matrix.browser.name }}
          npx playwright install-deps ${{ matrix.browser.name }}
      
      - name: Start application
        run: |
          npm start &
          sleep 10
          curl -f http://localhost:3000/health
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
      
      - name: Run E2E tests
        run: |
          npx playwright test \
            --project=${{ matrix.browser.name }} \
            --config=playwright.config.ts \
            --reporter=html,junit \
            --output-dir=test-results/${{ matrix.browser.name }}-${{ matrix.viewport.name }}
        env:
          BROWSER: ${{ matrix.browser.name }}
          BROWSER_VERSION: ${{ matrix.browser.version }}
          VIEWPORT_WIDTH: ${{ matrix.viewport.width }}
          VIEWPORT_HEIGHT: ${{ matrix.viewport.height }}
          BASE_URL: http://localhost:3000
      
      - name: Run performance tests
        if: matrix.performance
        run: |
          npm run test:performance:browser
          npm run lighthouse:ci
        env:
          BROWSER: ${{ matrix.browser.name }}
          VIEWPORT: ${{ matrix.viewport.name }}
      
      - name: Run accessibility tests
        if: matrix.accessibility
        run: |
          npm run test:a11y:browser
        env:
          BROWSER: ${{ matrix.browser.name }}
      
      - name: Upload browser test results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: browser-results-${{ matrix.browser.name }}-${{ matrix.browser.version }}-${{ matrix.viewport.name }}
          path: |
            test-results/${{ matrix.browser.name }}-${{ matrix.viewport.name }}/
            playwright-report/
            lighthouse-report/
            a11y-report/
          retention-days: 7

  # Job 4: Matrix Results Summary
  matrix-summary:
    name: üìä Matrix Results Summary
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-matrix, integration-matrix, browser-matrix]
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Download all test artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          path: ./all-results
      
      - name: Generate matrix summary
        run: |
          echo "# üß™ Matrix Testing Results" > matrix-summary.md
          echo "" >> matrix-summary.md
          
          echo "## Build Matrix Results" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| OS | Node | Package Manager | Status |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "|----|----|----------------|--------|" >> matrix-summary.md
          
          # Parse build results (simplified)
          echo "| Ubuntu | 18 | npm | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Windows | 18 | npm | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| macOS | 18 | npm | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          
          echo "" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "## Integration Matrix Results" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Platform | Database | Cache | Test Suite | Status |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "|----------|----------|-------|------------|--------|" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Ubuntu | postgres | redis | api | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Ubuntu | mysql | redis | graphql | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          
          echo "" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "## Browser Matrix Results" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Browser | Version | Viewport | Status |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "|---------|---------|----------|--------|" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Chrome | latest | desktop | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          echo "| Firefox | latest | mobile | ‚úÖ |" >> matrix-summary.md
          
          cat matrix-summary.md
      
      - name: Upload matrix summary
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: matrix-summary
          path: matrix-summary.md
          retention-days: 30

# Reusable Workflow: CI Template
# .github/workflows/reusable-ci.yml

name: üîÑ Reusable CI Workflow

on:
  workflow_call:
    inputs:
      node-version:
        description: 'Node.js version to use'
        required: false
        type: string
        default: '18'
      
      package-manager:
        description: 'Package manager to use'
        required: false
        type: string
        default: 'npm'
      
      run-tests:
        description: 'Whether to run tests'
        required: false
        type: boolean
        default: true
      
      run-security-scan:
        description: 'Whether to run security scanning'
        required: false
        type: boolean
        default: false
      
      environment:
        description: 'Target environment'
        required: false
        type: string
        default: 'development'
      
      working-directory:
        description: 'Working directory for the project'
        required: false
        type: string
        default: '.'
    
    outputs:
      build-success:
        description: 'Whether the build was successful'
        value: ${{ jobs.build.outputs.success }}
      
      test-results:
        description: 'Test results summary'
        value: ${{ jobs.test.outputs.results }}
      
      security-score:
        description: 'Security scan score'
        value: ${{ jobs.security.outputs.score }}
      
      artifact-name:
        description: 'Name of the build artifact'
        value: ${{ jobs.build.outputs.artifact-name }}
    
    secrets:
      SONAR_TOKEN:
        description: 'SonarCloud token for code analysis'
        required: false
      
      SNYK_TOKEN:
        description: 'Snyk token for security scanning'
        required: false
      
      NPM_TOKEN:
        description: 'NPM token for private packages'
        required: false
      
      CODECOV_TOKEN:
        description: 'Codecov token for coverage reporting'
        required: false

env:
  NODE_VERSION: ${{ inputs.node-version }}
  PACKAGE_MANAGER: ${{ inputs.package-manager }}
  WORKING_DIR: ${{ inputs.working-directory }}

jobs:
  # Job 1: Setup and Build
  build:
    name: üèóÔ∏è Build Application
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      success: ${{ steps.build-check.outputs.success }}
      artifact-name: ${{ steps.artifact.outputs.name }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: ${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}
          cache-dependency-path: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/package-lock.json
      
      - name: Setup package manager
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm)
              echo "Using npm"
              ;;
            yarn)
              npm install -g yarn
              ;;
            pnpm)
              npm install -g pnpm
              ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Configure NPM registry
        if: secrets.NPM_TOKEN
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          echo "//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" > .npmrc
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm ci --prefer-offline ;;
            yarn) yarn install --frozen-lockfile ;;
            pnpm) pnpm install --frozen-lockfile ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Lint code
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm run lint ;;
            yarn) yarn lint ;;
            pnpm) pnpm lint ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Type check
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm run type-check ;;
            yarn) yarn type-check ;;
            pnpm) pnpm type-check ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Build application
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm run build ;;
            yarn) yarn build ;;
            pnpm) pnpm build ;;
          esac
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
          ENVIRONMENT: ${{ inputs.environment }}
      
      - name: Build check
        id: build-check
        run: |
          if [ -d "${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/dist" ] || [ -d "${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/build" ] || [ -d "${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/.next" ]; then
            echo "success=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          else
            echo "success=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi
      
      - name: Create artifact
        id: artifact
        if: steps.build-check.outputs.success == 'true'
        run: |
          ARTIFACT_NAME="build-${{ github.repository_owner }}-${{ github.event.repository.name }}-${{ github.sha }}"
          echo "name=$ARTIFACT_NAME" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
      
      - name: Upload build artifacts
        if: steps.build-check.outputs.success == 'true'
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ${{ steps.artifact.outputs.name }}
          path: |
            ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/dist/
            ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/build/
            ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/.next/
            ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/package.json
          retention-days: 7

  # Job 2: Testing
  test:
    name: üß™ Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    if: inputs.run-tests && needs.build.outputs.success == 'true'
    outputs:
      results: ${{ steps.test-summary.outputs.results }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: ${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm ci ;;
            yarn) yarn install --frozen-lockfile ;;
            pnpm) pnpm install --frozen-lockfile ;;
          esac
      
      - name: Run unit tests
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm run test:unit -- --coverage ;;
            yarn) yarn test:unit --coverage ;;
            pnpm) pnpm test:unit --coverage ;;
          esac
        env:
          CI: true
      
      - name: Run integration tests
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          case "${{ env.PACKAGE_MANAGER }}" in
            npm) npm run test:integration ;;
            yarn) yarn test:integration ;;
            pnpm) pnpm test:integration ;;
          esac
        env:
          CI: true
      
      - name: Upload coverage
        if: secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/coverage/lcov.info
          token: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
          flags: reusable-workflow
      
      - name: Test summary
        id: test-summary
        run: |
          if [ -f "${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/coverage/coverage-summary.json" ]; then
            COVERAGE=$(node -p "require('${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/coverage/coverage-summary.json').total.lines.pct")
            echo "results=passed,coverage:${COVERAGE}%" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          else
            echo "results=passed,coverage:unknown" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi

  # Job 3: Security Scanning
  security:
    name: üîí Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    if: inputs.run-security-scan && needs.build.outputs.success == 'true'
    outputs:
      score: ${{ steps.security-score.outputs.score }}
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: npm ci
      
      - name: Audit dependencies
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          npm audit --audit-level high
          npm audit --json > audit-report.json
        continue-on-error: true
      
      - name: Snyk security scan
        if: secrets.SNYK_TOKEN
        uses: snyk/actions/node@master
        env:
          SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
        with:
          args: --severity-threshold=high --file=${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}/package.json
      
      - name: SonarCloud scan
        if: secrets.SONAR_TOKEN
        uses: SonarSource/sonarcloud-github-action@master
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          SONAR_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SONAR_TOKEN }}
        with:
          projectBaseDir: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
      
      - name: Calculate security score
        id: security-score
        run: |
          # Simplified security score calculation
          AUDIT_SCORE=85
          if [ -f "audit-report.json" ]; then
            VULNS=$(jq '.metadata.vulnerabilities.total' audit-report.json 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
            AUDIT_SCORE=$((100 - VULNS * 5))
            if [ $AUDIT_SCORE -lt 0 ]; then AUDIT_SCORE=0; fi
          fi
          echo "score=$AUDIT_SCORE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
      
      - name: Upload security reports
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: security-reports
          path: |
            audit-report.json
            snyk-report.json
          retention-days: 30

---

# Consumer Workflow: Frontend CI
# .github/workflows/frontend-ci.yml

name: üé® Frontend CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
    paths:
      - 'frontend/**'
      - '.github/workflows/frontend-ci.yml'
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
    paths:
      - 'frontend/**'

jobs:
  # Use the reusable workflow
  ci:
    name: üîÑ Frontend CI Pipeline
    uses: ./.github/workflows/reusable-ci.yml
    with:
      node-version: '18'
      package-manager: 'npm'
      run-tests: true
      run-security-scan: true
      environment: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && 'production' || 'development' }}
      working-directory: './frontend'
    secrets:
      SONAR_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SONAR_TOKEN }}
      SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
      NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
      CODECOV_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
  
  # Deploy if CI passes
  deploy:
    name: üöÄ Deploy Frontend
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: ci
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && needs.ci.outputs.build-success == 'true'
    environment:
      name: production
      url: https://app.example.com
    
    steps:
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.artifact-name }}
          path: ./build
      
      - name: Deploy to production
        run: |
          echo "Deploying frontend to production..."
          echo "Build artifact: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.artifact-name }}"
          echo "Test results: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.test-results }}"
          echo "Security score: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.security-score }}"
          
          # Deployment logic here
          aws s3 sync ./build s3://my-frontend-bucket --delete
          aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id E1234567890 --paths "/*"
      
      - name: Notify team
        run: |
          echo "‚úÖ Frontend deployed successfully!"
          echo "Security Score: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.security-score }}/100"

---

# Consumer Workflow: Backend CI
# .github/workflows/backend-ci.yml

name: üîß Backend CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
    paths:
      - 'backend/**'
      - '.github/workflows/backend-ci.yml'
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
    paths:
      - 'backend/**'

jobs:
  ci:
    name: üîÑ Backend CI Pipeline
    uses: ./.github/workflows/reusable-ci.yml
    with:
      node-version: '18'
      package-manager: 'npm'
      run-tests: true
      run-security-scan: true
      environment: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && 'production' || 'development' }}
      working-directory: './backend'
    secrets:
      SONAR_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SONAR_TOKEN }}
      SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
      NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
      CODECOV_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
  
  docker-build:
    name: üê≥ Build Docker Image
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: ci
    if: needs.ci.outputs.build-success == 'true'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Download build artifacts
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ${{ needs.ci.outputs.artifact-name }}
          path: ./backend/dist
      
      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
      
      - name: Build and push
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./backend
          push: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' }}
          tags: |
            ghcr.io/${{ github.repository }}-backend:latest
            ghcr.io/${{ github.repository }}-backend:${{ github.sha }}
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

troubleshooting.problem: Matrix build failing with 'matrix must be defined' error
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure matrix strategy is properly structured and contains valid combinations
troubleshooting.details: Matrix strategy requires proper YAML structure; use include/exclude for complex combinations

troubleshooting.problem: Reusable workflow not found or unauthorized
troubleshooting.solution: Check workflow path, repository permissions, and ensure workflow_call trigger is defined
troubleshooting.details: Reusable workflows must be in .github/workflows/ and accessible to calling repository

troubleshooting.solution: Configure environment protection rules and required reviewers correctly
troubleshooting.details: Environment protection rules require proper configuration in repository settings

troubleshooting.problem: Matrix job outputs not accessible in dependent jobs
troubleshooting.solution: Use job outputs and JSON arrays to aggregate matrix results
troubleshooting.details: Matrix job outputs require aggregation; use toJSON() and fromJSON() for complex data

troubleshooting.problem: Workflow inputs not working in reusable workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Define inputs correctly in workflow_call trigger and reference with inputs context
commands: inputs: { param: { type: string, required: true } }
troubleshooting.details: Workflow inputs must be defined in on.workflow_call.inputs section
